item.title: Osprey Games' Hide, Stone, and Bone Lets You Connect with Your Inner Caveman
item.content:encoded:
Pre-orders are now live for Osprey Games' newest skirmish game. Hide, Stone, and Bone is a notable departure from the studio's historical and fantastical routes, tasking players with ensuring the survival of early man during the Ice Age.

The Hide, Stone, and Bone Pre-Order Announcement

According to its store page, Hide, Stone, and Bone is a skirmish wargame of prehistoric survival. Players lead tribes of early men as they hunt and survive during the brutal conditions of the Ice Age.

These moments of survival are broken up into Big Days. Big Days represent substantive events like mammoth hunts, cave bear attacks, and clashes with rival tribes. Between these events, you must gather food, craft tools and weapons, and consult shamans for guidance. Once these events happen, break out the miniatures and the dice. These skirmishes and hunts are resolved using a d10-based alternating activation system.

The core experience of Hide, Stone, and Bone is its detailed campaign system. The ultimate goal is survival. This means, even if the dice are against you while fighting other tribes, your group can still thrive in the long run.

The game is the tabletop debut of Austin Hunt. According to his bio, Hunt has been a war gamer for over two decades, playing in multiple games across different genres. The book features illustrations by Netherlands artist Mars Oosterveld, whose work has also featured in Paleomythic.

Osprey Games is known for a diverse catalog of skirmish games. Their work has ranged from the miniature agnostic sci-fi dogfights of Voidfighter to the fantasy battles of Frostgrave. The studio has even produced historical wargames through its Undaunted series, which covers various theatres of battle in WW2, and the beloved Bolt Action.

Hide, Stone, and Bone is available for pre-order now on Osprey Games' website. It is available in both softcover (MSRP $25) and Ebook (MSRP $20) formats. The books are expected to ship in January, 2026.
